combined_dialog: It's not getting away from me this time.
''This'' is how you catch a fish.
Why is it that every time ''you'' play with magic water, ''I'' get soaked?
Yeah, yeah, "an ancient art unique to our culture", blah, blah, blah.
Look, I'm just saying that if I had weird powers, I'd keep my weirdness to myself.
Well, maybe you should've ''waterbended'' us out of the ice.
Okay, you've gone from "weird" to "freakish", Katara.
We don't know what that ''thing'' is!
How did you get in the ice?
Right, and this is Katara, my flying sister.
Did you see that crazy bolt of light?!
He was probably trying to signal the Fire Navy!
You just sneezed ... and flew ten feet in the air!
Giant light beams, flying bison, airbenders ...
I think I got midnight sun madness.
I'm going home to where stuff makes sense.
I'm not getting on that fluffy ''snot'' monster!
Wow, that was ''truly'' amazing ... What is this, a weapon?
Ya know, last time I checked, humans ''can't fly!''
You're an airbender, Katara's a waterbender.
Together you can just waste time ''all'' day long.
Now men, it's important that you show no fear when you face a firebender.
In the Water Tribe, we fight to the last man standing!
For without courage, how can we call ourselves men?
Until your fathers return from the War, they're counting on ''you'' to be the men of this tribe, and that means ''no potty breaks''!
Okay, who else has to go?
Katara, get him out of here!
We don't have time for fun and games with ''the War'' going on!
You signaled the Fire Navy with that flare!
You're leading them straight to us, aren't you?
The foreigner is banished from our village.
No, I'm keeping my promise to Dad.
I'm protecting you, from threats like him!
We can't fight firebenders with fun!
Would you really choose him over your tribe?
Let's see your bison fly now, ''air boy.''
The Fire Nation could be on our shores any moment now!
Are you gonna talk all day, or are you comin' with me?
Get in, we're going to save your boyfriend.
You just looove taking me out of my comfort zone, don't you?
What was it that kid said?
Katara, he's - I mean, big deal.
Well, I couldn't let you have ''all'' the glory.
I'm just a guy, with a boomerang.
I didn't ask for all this flying and ''magic!''
I'm'' trying'' to find us some food.
Who ate all of my blubbered seal jerky?!
No wonder the flames smelled so good.
So where do I get something to eat?
I'm just a simple guy, with simple needs.
Making him feel better is putting ''me'' in a world of hurt.
You know, you can't protect him forever.
And whoever's in there might have a medley of delicious cured meats!
I don't suppose you have a key?
Katara, you really believe in that stuff?
No wonder I didn't trust you when we first met.
You just couldn't get any weirder.
That firebender won't know what hit him.
Not if I get him first!
Aang, I wasn't ''really'' going to eat the lemur, okay?
He found out firebenders killed Gyatso!
Before he blows us off the mountain!
Katara and I aren't going to let anything happen to you.
You have no idea where you're going, do you?
I guess we're getting close then.
You need to give girls space when they do their sewing.
Girls are better at fixing pants than guys and guys are better at hunting and fighting and stuff like that.
It's just the natural order of things.
We just made a pit stop yesterday.
Shouldn't we get a little more flying done before we camp out?
Still, hard to argue with a ten-ton magical monster.
The fish is doing all the work.
Well, let's not stick around to find out.
Or, we could stay a while.
Where are the men who ambushed us?
Wait a second, there's no way that a bunch of girls took us down.
I'll show them a thing or two.
I'm not scared of any girls.
Who do they think they are anyway?
I can't believe I got beat up by a bunch of girls.
Sorry ladies, didn't mean to interrupt your dance lesson.
I was just looking for somewhere to get a little workout?
I mean, normally I'd hold a grudge, but seeing as you guys are a bunch of girls, I'll make an exception.
After all, I'm the best warrior in my village.
I ... Well, if that's what you want, I'd be happy to.
All right, you stand over there.
Now, this may be a little tough, but try to block me.
Of course, I was going easy on you.
Let's see if you can handle ''this''!
I would be honored if you would teach me.
I'm sorry if I insulted you earlier.
Do I really have to wear this?
I think I'm starting to get it.
Hey, I'm not a ... oh, whatever!
I treated you like a girl when I should've treated you like a warrior.
Now you look just like my grandfather.
If you think we're going to fit through there, you're crazier than that king.
Eh, how was Appa supposed to save us anyway?
You know, because of all the rocks.
Why did you do all of this instead of just telling Aang who you were?
Shouldn't we run ''away'' from huge booms?
He looks dangerous, so we better approach cautiously.
I worked hard to get those nuts!
How long has the Fire Nation been here?
Everyone should get some sleep, we're leaving at dawn.
This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops.
If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast.
Then it's too late to track him, he's long gone.
I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work.
There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines.
All Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here.
By ''this,'' do you mean intentionally being captured by a group of ruthless firebenders?
Get out of my way, pipsqueak!
No, you idiot, it's the girl!
You've got twelve hours to find Haru.
What do you mean you're not leaving?
I hate when you get like this.
Wouldn't he just take his keys with him?
For that they'd need some kind of earth, or some rock.
These vents reminded me of our little trick back at the village.
We're gonna do the same thing, but on a much bigger scale.
There's a huge deposit of coal at the base of the silo.
And the whole system is ventilated.
Aang closed off all the vents except one.
When he does his airbending the coal only has one place to go, right back here.
I'm not allowed to be angry?
We're all going to get eaten by a spirit monster.
We can't sit here and cower while Aang waits for some monster to show up.
He still shouldn't have to face this alone.
It doesn't seem too interested in what he's saying.
Maybe we should go help him.
Like I seriously need to use the bathroom.
You could give us some supplies, and some money.
At least, not without your friends.
Can't you make Appa go any faster?
We got into the Fire Nation.
Refreshed and ready to fight some firebenders!
Do you know where you're going?
You're only a hundred years late!
I think I can help you out.
This is a little trick I picked up from my father.
I seal the lamp oil inside an animal skin casing, Shyu lights the oil soaked twine and, ta-da!
That firebending looked as strong as any firebending I've seen.
How are ''we'' gonna make it out of this?
If we hit a bump, you'll go flying off.
You pretty much mastered airbending and that only took you a hundred and twelve years.
I'm sure you can master three more elements by next summer.
So what am I supposed to do?
So, while you guys are playing in the water, I'm supposed to be hard at work picking mud out of a giant bison's feet?
You just "practiced" our supplies down the river.
My life was hard enough when you were just an airbender.
We've got exactly three copper pieces left from the money that King Bumi gave us.
Even Momo thinks it's a piece of junk.
Wait a minute ... Sea loving traders, with suspiciously acquired merchandise, and pet reptile birds?
Yeah, I was just starting to browse through their boomerang collection.
No wonder they were trying to hack us up!
You put all of our lives in danger just so you could learn some stupid, fancy splashes.
It's just a matter of time before she gets us all in deep- Oh, what?
I'm not good enough to kidnap?
You're really gonna hand over ''the Avatar'' for a stupid piece of parchment?
Sure is, and I'll bet he'll fetch a lot more on the black market than that fancy scroll.
I'm just sayin' it's bad business sense.
Think how much the Fire Lord would pay for the Avatar.
You guys would be set for life.
We'd need a team of rhinos to budge this ship.
This thing wasn't made by the Water Tribe!
Would you two quit congratulating each other and help me out?
This is no time for flute practice!
Is that really how you feel?
Right, got it ... Ordinarily, you'd be right, but seeing how it's the dry season, you're not.
Besides that tarp makes a pretty warm blanket.
Then I would have put up the tarp for nothing.
Katara, why don't you worry about gathering firewood, because that kindling is looking pretty sorry.
Fine by me, if you're not gonna do your job- Why don't you ask Miss Know-It-All, Queen of the Twigs.
Then I'm sure we'll be able to see it very clearly from the air while we fly away.
Calm down, we know you're next.
Aang, this feuding tribe stuff is serious business.
Are you sure it's a good idea getting involved in this?
His job's gonna make us cross this whole canyon on foot isn't it?
I thought the whole point of ditching our food was so we wouldn't have to deal with things like canyon crawlers.
So, you guys aren't going to put up your tarps?
Yeah Katara, what are you talking about?
Wei Jin didn't steal the orb, he was returning it to their village gate and was wrongfully punished by the Gan Jin.
I only took their side 'cause they fed me.
That's some luck you knew Jin Wei and Wei Jin.
Don't have to tell me twice.
We shouldn't go to the market.
Out of food and out of money.
Now what are we supposed to do?
You said get a job ... and he's ''paying double''.
I said I was going to do this job.
I can't back out just because of some bad weather.
Seriously, you're still going to pay me, right?
You know what I love about Appa the most?
Water ... Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness?
You are so going to be dinner!
Maybe instead of saving the world, you can go into the jewelry-making business.
No, punch him in the bill!
Lucky for you, we came along.
Of course she predicted it was going to rain.
The sky's been gray all day!
Look, I'm going to predict the future now.
I can't believe we're here in the house of nonsense.
It would be nice to have some bean curd puffs.
Love, who she's going to marry, how many babies she's going to have.
Looks like someone had a pretty good bathroom break.
I don't even want to know!
Okay, let's get this over with.
But you didn't read my palms or anything!
Well, now you got to see for yourselves how fortune telling is just a big, stupid hoax.
My life will calm and happy and joyful!
I can't believe you would trust your lives to that crazy, old woman's superstition!
I can't believe all these saps!
Someone really needs to scream some sense into them.
I'm going to prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense.
Hey you, I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she?
Uh huh ... And how many times have you worn those shoes since you got that fortune?
I don't care what Aunt Wu told you!
You have to take a bath sometime!
You've come to the right place.
What can I do you for?
I think I know who you mean.
And to tell you the truth, I've been picking up a subtle vibe that she likes you, too.
Oh yeah, she's crazy about you.
All you have to do now is not mess it up.
The number once mistake nice guys like you make: being too nice.
If you want to keep her interested, you have to act aloof, like you don't really care one way or the other.
I can't believe you're dragging me all the way up here for a stupid flower.
Flowers are fine once you're married, but at this early stage, it's critical that you maintain maximum aloofness.
Don't tell me you believe in that stuff, too.
Those people all think they're safe!
Well, we have other things to worry about.
Aunt Wu was wrong about the volcano.
Everyone, that volcano is gonna blow any second!
Can your fortune telling explain that?
Something is happening in the clouds.
Lava is gonna flow downhill to this spot.
If we can dig a deep enough trench we can channel all the lava away from the village to the river.
Everybody else grab a shovel Come on!
Man, sometimes I forget what a powerful bender that kid is.
Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.
No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortune telling.
This is a Water Tribe weapon.
See if you can find anything else.
Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders.
The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.
No, but it's from his fleet.
I'm strong, I'm brave, I can fight!
Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much.
Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things!
So, who was it that came up with the Great Blubber Fiasco?
It's a long one Aang, some other time.
Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?
It's been over two years since we've seen Dad.
It would be great, but we can't.
We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.
Is this the boat he took you ice dodging in?
How are we supposed to ice dodge without ice?
Aang, ease up on the jib.
Aang, I'm gonna need air in that sail.
Katara, I want you to bend as much water as you can between us and those rocks.
This is the map to our father!
You had it the whole time?
Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own.
I wanna see Dad, but, helping Aang is where we're needed the most.
I'm ... starting to get some feeling back!
That thing sees with its nose.
Let's give him something to look at.
Yeah, we've lost too much time as it is.
And right now, you need us more.
I wonder why they left this boat?
I don't want to talk about it.
See if you can find a menu, I'm starving!
It's like you're a whole different person ... Where are we gonna get masks like that?
Knowing the Fire Nation, it's probably an execution.
What do you think you're doing?
No, we don't want to make a scene!
I think it's time to go.
I hope he can really hear that bison whistle!
You really know your explosives ... You're a Fire Nation Soldier!
He was very highly ranked, we get it.
We're ''not'' gonna go find some ''crazy'' firebender!
Look, thanks for the help, but we're leaving for the North Pole in the morning.
That's what you said about going to the festival!
Why doesn't anyone ever listen to me?
Hold on, you know these guys?
I told you we shouldn't mess around with this!
Oh ... Well then thanks for all the first aid over the years.
Like when I fell into the greaseberry bramble.
Or that time I had two fishhooks in my thumb!
Oh, and the time that mink snake bit me!
Sorry ... You want me to be like you, or totally honest?
We better find some solid ground, before it finds us.
Wait, how can you tell the time from that thing?
The notches all look the same.
You put spark powder in the candle!
Why would you want to use fireflies for light?
Okay ... so you brought me all the way down here to see an empty room.
So, this place is an explosion waiting to happen.
How can something so small that you can't even see it make such a big stink!?
Yeah ... if we put a whole mess of rotten eggs in the cellar where the gas seeps up ... Then, if there's a leak ... And plug up the hole where the gas is escaping!
You make weapons for the Fire Nation?!
See, the problem with the old war balloon was you could get it air-borne, but once it did, it just kept going.
You could put a hole in the top, but then all the hot air would escape.
So the question became, how do you keep a lid on hot air?
A lid is actually the answer.
If you control the hot air, you control the war balloon.
Okay, we've got four kinds of bombs: smoke, slime, fire, and ... Hey, why aren't they shooting at us?
Then I guess they won't see this coming.
Oh no, that was the last one.
That's were the gas is escaping.
It's the only bomb we've got.
Aang you were right about air power.
As long as we've got the skies, we'll have the Fire Nation on the run.
So ... uhhh ... you're a princess, huh?
You know, back in my tribe, I'm kind of like a prince, myself.
I'm trying to have a conversation here.
So, it looks like I'm going to be in town for a while.
I'm thinking ... maybe we could ... do an activity, together?
How about that picnic last night?
Boy, your dad sure does know how to throw a party.
Well, it wasn't as much fun after you left.
So, I'm still hoping we can see more of each other.
Yes ... at a place ... for some time.
That's okay, it was worth it.
Actually, it's supposed to be a fish.
I don't get it, one minute she wants to go out with me, and the next, she's telling me to get lost.
Why don't you just teach her, Aang?
You're not going to win this fight!
I just want you to know, I think you're beautiful, and, I never thought a girl like you would even notice a guy like me.
I think I do understand now.
You don't have to say anything.
I grew up in a block of ice.
It's not exactly a cultural hub.
You need to meet my good friend, Appa.
Appa and I go way back, don't we, boy?
Yeah, we pretty much live up here.
I've seen this before, right before my village was attacked.
They've closed in on the North Pole and from the looks of this stuff, I'd say there's a lot of them.
You don't love him, do you?
You don't even seem to like him.
Fire Navy uniforms don't look like that.
When, like, a hundred years ago?
The Fire Nation doesn't wear shoulder spikes anymore.
The newer uniforms are more streamlined.
Princess Yue is wasted on a self-absorbed weasel like you!
Hahn's out there on the top-secret mission while I'm here sharpening my boomerang.
What, you want me to scrub the barracks?
Where did they go ... You did everything you could, and now we need to do everything we can to get him back.
They're not going to die in this blizzard.
If we know anything, it's that Zuko never gives up.
They'll survive, and we'll find them.
Hey, this is some quality rope!
Yeah, this makes a lot of sense.
Let's bring the guy who's constantly trying to kill us.
You don't have to do that.
Your father told me to protect you.
But sir, the thing is, Aang can only do those things when he's in the Avatar State.
Remember when he took out the Fire Navy?
Or just glow it up and stop that Fire Lord!
I guess he could talk the Fire Lord to death.
Maybe I can shock you into the Avatar State.
He's trying to force Aang into the Avatar State!
Anybody got a problem with that?
You guys are going to be done soon, right?
We have a lot of ground to cover if we're going to make it to Omashu today.
I could be ready in two minutes.
Look, I hate to be the wet blanket here, but since Katara is busy, I guess it's up to me.
We need to get to Omashu.
No sidetracks, no worms and definitely no rainbows.
I think we'll just stick with flying.
We've dealt with the Fire Nation before.
How far are we from the tunnel?
There's no way we're going through some cursed hole!
All we need is a plan.
Chong, how long do those torches last?
It doesn't work like that if they're all lit at the same time!
I'm going to make a map to keep track of exactly where we've been.
Then we should be able to solve it like a maze and get through.
We already came through this way.
Right, if only we listened to you.
At least I'm ''thinking'' of ideas and trying to get us out of here, Moku.
No, they were trying to get away from something!
Come on guys, help me out!
How did you guys get out?
We let huge, ferocious beasts lead our way.
The journey was long and annoying, but now you get to see what it's really about: the destination.
I present to you the Earth Kingdom city of O- Oh no ... Up until now it was.
Now Ba Sing Se is the only great Earth Kingdom stronghold left.
We don't even know if Bumi's still ... A-around.
Why didn't we just use this last time?
Where would they be keeping him?
You're all about to come down with a nasty case of pentapox.
The marks make ya look sick, but you gotta act sick too.
Now that's what I'm talkin' about.
You realize we're probably walking right into a trap.
Hey, you taking us down for a reason?
Aang, why are we going down?
Is it telling you where we can get something to eat?
No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on.
See, even Appa and Momo don't like it here.
You better throw in an extra "yip"!
Why do things keep attaching to me?!
Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?
I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.
There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them.
We'll have to make camp for the night.
Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.
I think we should build a fire.
Please, we're all alone out here.
You think you're so tough, huh?
This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ...
I ... hit my head running away last night.
What do you guys think you're doing!?
I've been looking all over for you!
Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!
Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us.
That's why we all saw things out here.
Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.
For the last time, there's nothing after us and there's nothing magical happening here.
Stuff like that happens to us a lot.
Not a monster, just a regular guy defending his home.
Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to find Appa and Momo.
So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa?
You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.
Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here.
Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.
I told you, we were hungry.
That's Avatar stuff, that doesn't count.
The only thing I can't figure out is how you made that tornado that sucked us down.
Still, there's absolutely nothing mysterious about the swamp.
What are you doing in my mouth?
Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries.
Oh, I see, so there's time to get your scrolls and time to get your staff, but no time for my boomerang?
I feel like I've lost part of my identity.
Imagine if you lost your arrow, or Katara lost her ... hair loopies.
I used to be boomerang guy ... And here comes Avatar Roku!
And it's nice to appreciate their deep-fried festival food!
Now a torch, that's a nice prop.
But I'm not sure I could carry it off.
So some people don't like you, big deal!
There's a whole nation of firebenders who hate you.
Now let's bust you out of here!
How're we gonna to do that?
The crime happened over three hundred years ago.
Well, I guess I could be classified as such.
Everyone wanted to blame it on the polar leopard, but I figured out it was Old Man Jarko wearing polar leopard boots!
See, a real eight hundred-pound polar leopard would have left much deeper tracks.
Okay, I guess I am pretty good.
But I'm going to need some new props.
This temple and this statue were cut from the same stone.
And we know that the statue was built after Chin died.
That means Kyoshi never set foot in this temple!
We need to go to Kyoshi Island.
So, uh ... what's Suki up to?
These things mean anything to you?
There's no way Kyoshi could have made that footprint.
And therefore there is nothing linking her to the crime scene.
Wait, are you sure it was today?
This ceremony didn't take place at sunrise.
If Kyoshi was in the ceremony at sunset, she couldn't have been in Chin committing the crime.
I do believe in the power of stuff.
This is by far the worst town we've ever been to.
It's pricey ... but I really do like it.
Oh, I got to remember that one!
I don't need a new bag!
Why did you let me buy this?
Go back to the Fire Nation!
The Boulder knows how to put the hurt in the dirt!
I've got to admit, now I'm really glad I bought this bag.
Don't answer to Twinkle Toes, it's not manly!
Look, we all have to do our part to win this war, and yours is to teach Aang earthbending.
Whoever took Aang and Toph left this.
Well, we'd better get out of here, before your dad changes his mind again.
Your powers of perception are frightening.
Hey, I'm just enjoying the show.
Okay, forget about setting up camp.
I'm finding the softest pile of dirt and going to sleep.
Oh, just some angry freak with a ponytail who's tracked us all over the world.
This is a warrior's wolf tail.
Anyway, whoever's chasing us couldn't have followed us here, so, now would everyone just shhh?
Always the optimist ... Actually Toph, there's four of us.
Oh no, the sun is rising.
We've been up all night with no sleep!
Okay, we've put in a lot of distance between us and them.
The plan right now is to follow Appa's lead and get some sleep.
Yeah, you two were pretty much jerks.
Okay, but what are we going to do about the tank full of dangerous ladies chasing us?
Toph couldn't have made it too far.
Appa, come on, we need to go faster!
Thanks Appa, I don't know what we'd do without you.
You're awfully cute, but unfortunately you're made of meat.
You are one lucky little meat creature.
You probably think I deserve this, don't you?
Look, I'm sorry I hunted you, but that's just the natural order of things.
Big things eat smaller things, nothing personal.
But this time it didn't work out that way.
Okay, you convinced me, if I get out of this alive, it's a karmically correct, vegetarian existence for me.
Even though meat is so tasty.
Hey, looks like my karma is already paying off!
Okay, karma person or thing, whoever's in charge of this stuff.
If I can just get out of this situation alive, I will give up meat and sarcasm.
It's pretty much my whole identity.
Sokka, the meat and sarcasm guy.
But I'm willing to be Sokka, the veggies and straight talk fellow.
You're going to pull my fingers off and I don't think the rest of me is coming!
Seriously Aang, I know you're new at it, but I could use a little earthbending here.
Well, if you can't earthbend me out of here, go get Toph.
Well, I wouldn't want you to feel uncomfortable ...
Awkward position, I think I know the feeling.
Aang, this is my friend, Foo Foo Cuddlypoops.
He looks nothing like a saber-tooth moose-lion.
Aang, this is bad, you've got to get me out of here!
Please Aang, you have to earthbend me out, there's no other way!
Awww, this is a really wonderful, touching moment.
So could you get me out of here so I can give you both a big, snuggly hug?
This is great and all, but don't we have more important things to worry about?
Even if you do master all of the elements, then what?
It's not like we have a map of the Fire Nation.
Should we just head west until we reach the Fire Lord's house?
We need some intelligence if we're going to win this war.
I don't see anything wrong with having one of those fruity beverages while we plan our strategy.
So Professor, you're obviously a well-traveled guy.
Do you have a more current map?
Ours seems to be a little dated.
Doesn't anybody have a good map of that place?
Oh, so this spirit has attractive assistants, huh?
If this place has books from all over the world, do you think they've got info on the Fire Nation?
Aang, I do believe it's my turn.
I'd like to spend my vacation at the library!
You gotta work here a little longer before you qualify for vacation time.
Professor, would you like to see our sky bison?
What kind of animal is that?
No, this is the library- look!
That fox thingy went in through a window.
I say we climb up there and give it a look.
Are you the spirit who brought this library to the physical world?
I'm not lying, I'm here with the Avatar, and he's the bridge between our worlds.
Oh, great spirit, check this out.
"The darkest day in Fire Nation history."
It's got a date at the top, but it doesn't say anything else.
I want to know what happened to the Fire Nation on their darkest day.
The information on the Fire Nation should be right up here.
Just when I think I'm one step ahead of the Fire Nation, it turns out they beat us here a long time ago.
I need to know what happened on the darkest day.
Um, sure, I guess I'll follow you.
Uh, this is beautiful, but how is it helpful?

How did they get in here?
Except we'll get blown up the second that third-eyed freak sees us.
How could you let this happen?!
You assured me this was one of the most secure places in the world.
Maybe it wasn't a guard after all.
Maybe it was someone a little higher up the food chain.
Aiwei, why don't you question Su?
He must have collapsed the tunnel behind him.
Get all available guards to search the mountainside, and find out where this tunnel exits immediately!
There could be other secret agents in other parts of the world looking for you right now!
I'm taking you back to Republic City, where I can protect you.
I've been waiting to leave for half an hour.
I thought we were on the same page about this, and then you go and stab me in the back?
First, you scare the life out of me, now you want to lick me.
Here, chew on this and leave me alone.
I've found Korra's jeep, but the kids aren't here.
Meet me at the Misty Palms Oasis.
Thanks for ditching me back at Zaofu.
Some people at the inn saw them captured by Zaheer's crew.
We don't know where they are.
We need to get to a place that has a strong radio transmitter.
The Metal Clan will have one.
It's going to be okay, Su.
We can't protect you in there.
That Combustion Lady will pick us off one by one.
We come up from the valley, scale the side of the mountain and take them off guard.
Radio the second you see those airbenders.
Come and get me, you Third-Eyed Freak!
How did you guys make it out of the temple alive?
I wouldn't believe it either if I hadn't seen it for myself.
We need to figure out where Zaheer took Korra.
We need to get to those caves.
We have to get these two out of here now.
You'd never be able to keep up with Zaheer.
The chances of you being assassinated are almost zero.
I don't know how to tell you this ... you're going to Ba Sing Se ... with the prince.
I tried to get you out of it, but it's over my head.
He says he doesn't know what he'd do without you.
You're just a pawn in Raiko's diplomatic game.
You can try talking to him, but I don't think he's going to let you quit.
She told us that she was going to turn over power and she didn't.
I say we go on the offensive and start by retaking Zaofu.
Pardon me, lovebirds, but I need a word with Opal.
I'm sorry, kid, but Raiko couldn't convince the other leaders to attack Kuvira.
Looks like we're going to have to save them ourselves.
''This'' is an unsanctioned and dangerous mission into enemy territory.
We can't ask other people to risk their necks for our family.
If we want to break them out, we'll have to do it alone.
Somebody get a hold of Tenzin.
I don't think ''anyone'' should be going in there right now.
She's got a whole battalion of troops stationed there.
There's no way we'll be able to spot anything useful from here.
We'll have to go in for a closer look.
So, you already checked the city for Su?
How did you know she was captured?
It's not his silver tongue, I can tell you that.
Su and I finally worked out our old grievances.
Why would you need soldiers guarding an empty cavern?
They must have them in some kind of suspended prison, so they can't use their earthbending.
Yeah, you're a real sensitive instructor.
Yeah, let's not linger on the fact that I grew up without a dad.
No need to get all touchy-feely about it.
Just one of those things, right?
And not knowing my dad is nonsense to you?
It was pretty important to me.
And until now, you would never even discuss it.
You know, after Su and I patched things up, I thought, "maybe I should try to reach out to mom."
But now that we're together again, I remember why we stopped talking.
You make me furious and you don't even know why.
And when I tell you, you don't care.
Once we save Su, you and I are finished.
Shoot me over to the cage and I can swing them back on my cable.
Bolin, you'll have to catch them since mom won't be able to see them.
We'll get you out one at a time.
You can't go in there, kid.
I'm sorry for what I said last night.
My guess is, she's coming by rail.
It's the only way she can transport that weapon.
You might not make such a bad king after all.
Air Temple Island is the ideal location for your base of operations and you'll be safe here.
I'm going to check for survivors.
Glad to see you all made it out.
We can't metalbend any of it!
I'm going to see if I can find any help!
I got him out of jail to help.
I figured we need all the geniuses we can get our hands on right now.
If the prison's still standing after all this is over, we can throw him back in.
Is this your polar bear dog, miss?
Were you trying to send a message to the Triads yesterday?
Amon, how do you want to handle this?
You benders need to understand, there's no place in the world for you anymore.
We're here to fix a spider-rat problem.
What are you two doing here?
Amon wants extra security at the arena today.
You should've been briefed about this.
Everything the Avatar said is true, isn't it?
I just saw you bloodbend her.
I dedicated my life to you!
So, the Avatar has arrived early.
It looks like we'll have to accelerate our plans.
Zolt has amassed a fortune by extorting and abusing nonbenders.
But his reign of terror is about to come to an end.
Now, in the interest of fairness, I will give Zolt the chance to fight to keep his bending.
After I take your bending away, you will be nothing.
As you have heard, the Republic Council has voted to make me public enemy number one, proving once again that the bending oppressors of this city will stop at nothing to quash our revolution.
Our numbers grow stronger by the day.
You no longer have to live in fear.
The time has come for benders to experience fear.
I received your invitation, young Avatar.
Our showdown, while inevitable, is premature.
Although it would be the simplest thing for me to take away your bending right now, I won't.
Benders of every nation would rally behind your untimely demise, but I assure you, I have a plan.
And I'm saving you for last, then you'll get your duel, and I ''will'' destroy you.
Good morning, citizens of Republic City.
I hope you all enjoyed last night's pro-bending match, because it will be the last.
It's time for this city to stop worshiping bending athletes as if they were heroes.
I am calling on the council to shut down the bending arena and cancel the finals, or else there will be severe consequences.
Everything is going according to plan.
I believe I have your attention, benders of Republic City.
So once again, the Wolfbats are your pro-bending champions.

It seems fitting that you celebrate three bullies who cheated their way to victory because every day, you threaten and abuse your fellow nonbending citizens just like the Wolfbats did to their opponents tonight.
Those men were supposedly the best in the bending world and yet it only took a few moments for me to cleanse them of their impurity.
Let this be a warning to all of you benders out there: if any of you stand in my way, you will meet the same fate.
Now, to my followers: for years the Equalists have been forced to hide in the shadows, but now we have the numbers and the strength to create a new Republic City.
I'm happy to tell you that the time for change has finally come.
Very soon, the current tyrannical bending regime will be replaced by a fair-minded Equalist government.
You and your children will no longer have to walk the streets afraid!
It's time to take back our city.
For centuries, benders have possessed an unnatural advantage over ordinary people.
But thankfully, modern technology has provided us with a way to even out the playing field.
Now anyone can hold the power of a chi blocker in their hand.
My followers and I will not rest until the entire city achieves equality, and once that goal is achieved, we will equalize the rest of the world.
It is time for you to be equalized.
Electrocute the box to knock her out before you open it.
Yes, the time has come for the Equalists to claim Republic City as their own.
We'll capture them before long and you will have your daughter back.
Tell me where the Avatar is and I'll let you keep your bending.
Thank you all for joining me on this historic occasion!
When I was a boy, a firebender struck down my entire family and left me scarred.
That tragic event began my quest to equalize the world.
Making up stories about me is a pathetic last resort.
Hmph, an amusing tale, but I will show you the truth.
''This'' is what a ''firebender'' did to me.
Tonight, I rid the world of airbending, forever.
You're welcome to come down here and try to stop me.
The Avatar needs to be reminded of the power I possess.
I told you I would destroy you.
No one has ever gotten the better of me like that.
It is almost a shame to take the bending of someone so talented.
The world doesn't need you anymore.
I told you I would destroy you.
Okay, guys, I think we finally ditched him.
Republic City welcomes a new citizen into our arms.
After years of seclusion in the South, this master of water, earth, and fire seeks to add airbending to her list of skills.
And under the tutelage of Tenzin, Avatar Aang's son, she should go far.
But will this cool, calm, collective master of air be able to tame this hotheaded teen?
He advances, fires two quick shots.
Yomo is hammered back to zone three!
Clock is winding down, can Yomo hold on?
He's teetering on the edge of the ring now.
The Fire Ferrets line up to strik- The rookie Ferrets came from out of nowhere and have made it further than anyone expected this season.
But tonight, they face their toughest test yet, folks.
The two teams waste no time trying to blast each other out of zone one!
Hasook is the first to feel the heat of the Tigerdillos!
He tries to return the favor, but they're too fast for him, while Mako shows off his trademark "cool under fire" style!
Oooh, the Tigerdillos score with a walloping one-two combo!
Can their teammate hold on to their zone one territory?
The Tigerdillos get the green light and advance into Ferret territory!
Assuming the fabulous bending brothers can hold their ground until the next round.
The Fire Ferrets cinch the round in the closing seconds!
It's one apiece, still anyone's match as we go into the third and final round!
What a wing-dinger of a hat trick, folks!
Mako pulls off the upset of the season, winning the match for the Fire Ferrets!
Looks like the Fire Ferrets have ferreted out a last minute replacement waterbender.
Let's see if she's another diamond in the rough like the brothers from the school of hard knocks!
And we're back in action after that hiccup, but I'm not so sure this replacement player knows what she's doing.
Hold on, folks, we're just waiting for the referee's official call, but ... I-I think this replacement player could be ... no, there's no way!
This girl may be the Avatar, but she's no pro-bender and the Platypus Bears are intent on exploiting that weakness!
They're giving her their best, and her best ain't good enough to stop it!
The Platypus Bears come out of the gate and quickly go after the Ferret brothers!
They're corralled in the corner, wedged in the edge of zone one, unable to come to the Avatar's rescue!
And boy, does she need it!
Looks like the Avatar's pro-bending debut is going to be cut short!
She's been pushed back to zone three, and the water is calling her name!
It's only a matter of time before ...
She's still in the game, folks!
And she's moving like an entirely different player!
All of a sudden, the Platypus Bears' strikes are only striking air!
The Platypus Bears have no juice left, but Mako and Bolin are still fresh and juicy!
The Fire Ferrets come from ''waaay'' behind and steal the win!
The rookies, Avatar in tow, have nabbed a place in the championship tournament!
A chance encounter turns Korra from pro-bending spectator to pro-bending star.
With her new teammates, Mako and Bolin, the Fire Ferrets earn a place in the championship tournament.
But meanwhile, an anti-bending revolution brews in Republic City.
And what nefarious plan does the mysterious man behind the mask have in store for our hero?
After coming face to face with Amon, leader of the Equalists, Avatar Korra discovers a terrifying truth: this masked mad man has the ability to take away a person's bending, permanently.
Benders of Republic City are counting on their young Avatar.
But is she prepared to face such a frightening foe?
Since Avatar Korra has arrived in Republic City she's only had eyes for one fellow: Mako.
The feeling seemed mutual until a fateful accident intervened.
Now Mako's affections have fallen right into the arms of the beautiful Asami.
Will love prove to be Korra's most formidable foe yet?
Folks, after a year of waiting the Pro-bending Championship is finally here.
Tonight is the first set of matches in our single elimination sixteen team bracket.
And I gotta tell ya, these are the most tenacious and talented bending trios this arena has ever seen.
Both teams quickly recover and unleash a barrage of bending.
I am astonished with the level of improvement displayed here by the Fire Ferrets.
No wonder the Avatar has been absent from the papers lately.
She's obviously had her nose to the grindstone in the gym.
The Ferrets advance into Rabaroo territory and are holding nothing back.
Bolin strikes, Ula dodges, and all three Rabaroos are down.
The Fire Ferrets easily take round one!
The Rabaroos are looking for payback and they go straight after Bolin.
Korra comes to his defense and water-whacks Umi back into zone two!
The Ferrets are on fire tonight and they win round two.
With the Rabaroos down two rounds they'll need a knockout to win, and with the way the Fire Ferrets are playing I don't see that happening.
These Ferrets are working together like a well-oiled bending machine.
Bolin passes Adi back into zone two and the Ferrets get the green light to advance.
The Rabaroos are just fighting to stay at their feet at this point.
Out goes Adi, and Ula, and Umi!
Eight teams have been eliminated and eight advance into the quarter finals, which get underway way tonight.
The rookies are about to take on the former and longest-reigning champs, the Boar-q-pines.
Youth clashes against experience in a battle for the ages, or rather ''of'' the ages.
Korra dodges and, ''ooh'', slams right into her teammate!
Down goes Mako and Bolin and Korra!
The Ferrets looking to mount some offense here in round two.
Bolin lets fly a flurry of attacks, he's a one-man bending battalion.
The Ferrets are having a rough time finding their rhythm tonight, but thanks to Bolin, they narrowly notch round two.
Not sure what's eating them, but this is not the same team who took out the Rabaroos.
Looks like the earthbenders will collide in the tie-breaker face-off.
Bolin goes in for the grapple, Chang reverses.
Bolin strikes from midair, knocking Chang to the edge of the circle.
Another strike from Bolin, and Chang is in the drink!
Oh, that was a close one folks!
You can't find two teams more evenly matched in age, size, and strength than the Fire Ferrets and the Buzzard Wasps.
This should be a pulse-pounding semifinal, folks!
The Buzzard Wasps open with a flawlessly executed combo.
All three Ferrets take an early visit to zone two.
And Mako is knocked all the way back into zone three!
The Fire Ferrets have been struggling to stay alive since the opening bell.
All three players are totally out of sync tonight.
Ooh, that has got to sting!
Which reminds me, this match is brought to you by our sponsor, Flameo Instant Noodles!
Noodliest noodles in the United Republic.
The Buzzard Wasps fly deeper into Ferret territory.
And Mako plunges into the pool!
Can the Fire Ferrets hold on?
The Wasps have the Ferrets backed up to the edge now ... and the Ferrets are bailed out by the bell!
They had better pull themselves together for round two, otherwise they can kiss the finals goodbye.
The Wasps take advantage of Mako's unforced error and Bolin is in the pool!
Ooh, and a blatant hold by the Avatar!
And the Avatar is slapped with the yellow fan.
The Ferrets are their own worst enemy right now.
With the Buzzard Wasps leading two rounds to zilch, the Ferrets' only hope of winning is with a knockout.
Bolin's knocked into zone two, followed quickly by his brother!
And Bolin takes a zinger to the shoulder!
Looks like it's a clean hit.
Mako's in the drink and out of the match.
And Bolin keeps playing with one good arm!
I gotta hand it to him, this kid's got grit!
But how long can he keep it up?
The Ferrets' dream of making it to the finals now rests in the Avatar's hands.
But with three on one, I don't like her odds.
What an unbelievable effort here by Korra!
She's dodging every element the Wasps throw at her!
The Avatar finally gains some ground, but with only ten seconds remaining, it might be too little too late!
It didn't seem possible, folks, but the Fire Ferrets are headed to the finals!
With a brutal round one knockout, the defending champs secure their spot in the finals.
I hope the Ferrets know a good doctor, 'cause they're gonna need one!
After a close encounter with Amon, Korra took a leave of absence from Tarrlok's task force.
But the Avatar has still been hard at work, leading the underdog Fire Ferrets to the pro-bending championship finals.
Only one team stands in their way: the Wolfbats!
Led by team captain Tahno, the brutal Wolfbats look to repeat as champs.
Have the Fire Ferrets finally met their match?
The anticipation is palpable as we are just moments away from the championship match.
Will the Wolfbats' ferocity help them repeat as champs?
Or will the underdog Fire Ferrets serve up a surprising bowl of smackdown soup?
The champs and challengers face off at the center-line and here we go!
Tahno tries to clean the Avatar's clock with some dirty water boxing.
Ming shakes off Mako's attack and returns the favor.
Shaozu gets fancy, but Bolin ricochets a disk off the ropes and says 'No, thank you sir!'
The waterbenders slug it out, looking evenly matched.
Tahno gets a little too worked up and unleashes a deluge on Bolin that would certainly elicit a foul.
And the Wolfbats advance despite Tahno exceeding the waterbending time limit.
A questionable call by the officials.
Ming trips up Mako with another dirty trick!
The Ferret brothers are backed up to zone three and the Wolfbats smell blood.
Looks like Tahno snuck in an illegal icing move but once again there's no call.
I don't know what match the refs are watching but it's obviously not this one.
Oh ... a splash-and-clash sends the Avatar to zone three as well.
The Wolfbats win the championship for the fourth year in a- Hold on a second, folks!
The Ferrets are still alive, but just barely.
These Ferrets aren't just bending the elements, they're bending my mind!
The underdogs survive to see round two.
The opening salvo is a brutal call as both sides give it their all.
But once again, Tahno sneaks in a little ice to get the upper hand.
Those look like illegal head shots to me!
One round apiece: who wants it more?
The Wolfbats fly out of the gates, swinging with bad intentions.
The challengers are showing a lot of heart but the champs are really starting to find their rhythm now.
Can the Ferrets hang in there with the best, especially when the best are ''frankly'' getting a little help from the refs?
It's all down to this final round!
Mako is leaving it all in the ring but it looks like Tahno and Ming are up to more shenanigans!
Oh, this has gone too far!
That water had rocks in it!
Well, folks it's a controversial call but the Wolfbats notch a nasty knockout to win the match!
For the fourth year in a row, they'll be crowned tournament champions.
Folks, there is some sort of electrical disturbance in the stands.
Metalbender cops are dropping like bumbleflies.
There appear to be masked members of the audience wielding strange devices on their hands.
One of them is in the booth with me right now, folks!
He is leveling one of those glove devices at me now and I believe he is about to electrocute me.
I am currently wetting my pants.

After discovering that her father, Hiroshi Sato, is working with the enemy, Asami turns against him, and following another defeat at the hands of the Equalists, Lin Beifong resigns as Chief of Police.
With the Equalist army growing stronger, who will help the Avatar stop Amon and restore balance to the city?
After Tarrlok arrested her friends, Korra confronted the councilman in his chambers.
But the heated argument quickly turned into an all-out bending battle!
Desperate to save himself, Tarrlok revealed his ability to bloodbend and took Korra far from Republic City.
Will the Avatar's friends find her before it's too late?
Amon's revolution grows stronger by the day.
First, he attacked the bending arena!
Then it was discovered that Hiroshi Sato was the mastermind behind the Equalist gloves and mecha tanks!
And most recently, Amon ambushed Councilman Tarrlok, took his bending, and nearly captured the Avatar as well!
Everyone is on edge, wondering where will Amon strike next?
The Equalists are on the attack!
The Lieutenant and his chi blockers invaded Air Temple Island and forced Tenzin and his family to flee!
In the daring escape, Lin Beifong sacrificed herself and saved the airbenders, but she was captured and Amon took her bending away.
Now, Team Avatar is in hiding as they await help from General Iroh and the United Forces.
Korra and Mako have discovered the truth about Amon's identity.
He's a waterbender, a bloodbender, and brother to Tarrlok!
Now, Korra and Mako plan to infiltrate the Equalists' victory rally and expose Amon as a fraud.
Meanwhile, Asami, Bolin, and General Iroh head toward Hiroshi's secret airfield, where Asami intends to take down her father?
Six months ago, Avatar Korra defeated Amon and the Equalists.
Since then the council was disbanded and the United Republic elected its first president.
Tenzin's brother, Commander Bumi, retired and moved to Air Temple Island.
And Korra and her boyfriend Mako have been the talk of the town.
Peace has come to Republic City, but unbeknownst to the Avatar, danger now threatens the Southern Water Tribe.
Iiiiit's pro-bending night in Republic City, and have we got a ''doozy'' for ''you''!
Fan favorites, the Fire Ferrets, are about to take on hot newcomers, the Rhino Lions!
The Southern Water Tribe is under siege!
When Avatar Korra was attacked by a dark spirit, Chief Unalaq was the only one able to stop it.
So, Korra turned her back on Tenzin and chose Unalaq as her new spiritual mentor.
Tenzin and his family left for a vacation at the Southern Air Temple, while Korra remained in the Water Tribe.
Will she be able to restore balance between humans and spirits?
Korra has reopened the Southern spirit portal and taken the first step to restoring balance between spirits and man.
Meanwhile, tensions are high between Korra and her father after she discovered he was hiding a dark secret.
Years ago, Tonraq was banished from the North.
And now the Northern navy has landed on Southern shores.
What other plans does Unalaq have for the Avatar?
Tensions between the Northern and Southern Water Tribes have reached a breaking point.
After Chief Unalaq's troops took over the South, Varrick incited an uprising.
But Korra stopped the rebels from abducting her uncle.
Enraged by the insurrection, Unalaq arrested the rebels and Korra's parents, accusing them of conspiring to assassinate him.
Will Korra be able to save her parents and prevent civil war?
It's brother versus brother in the war of the Water Tribes.
After Korra discovered that Chief Unalaq betrayed her and her father, she turned against him, sparking civil war.
The Southern rebels rallied around Tonraq, but they are vastly outnumbered, so Korra is headed to Republic City to seek aid.
But will she be able to convince President Raiko to send troops to help the South?
Folks, that cheer you're hearing is for local favorite, Bolin, of the Fire Ferrets.
Let's see if we can get a quick interview.
Bolin, the Fire Ferrets are out for the season.
How have you been spending your time lately?
Do you miss being in the ring?
Someone has attacked the Southern Water Tribe Cultural Center.
All the evidence points to Northern sympathizers, but Mako suspects there's more to this case.
Meanwhile, Varrick has cast Bolin as the hero of his newest mover.
Asami has also ventured into business with Varrick, and a shipment of her mecha tanks is on its way to help the South in its war against Unalaq.
After President Raiko refused Korra's request to aid the South in the war of the Water Tribes, she headed to the Fire Nation, seeking a new ally against Unalaq.
But unbeknownst to her friends, a dark spirit attacked Korra and dragged her into the ocean.
She has washed up on a desolate island with no memory of who she is.
Avatar Korra has lost her memory!
In order to restore it, she has connected with Wan, who would become the very first Avatar.
Banished from his home, Wan survived for two years in the Spirit Wilds and learned to master fire.
But then, Wan split the spirits of light and dark, Raava and Vaatu, unwittingly plunging the world toward annihilation.
Will he be able to stop him?
By connecting with the original Avatar, Korra learned that to stop Unalaq she must close the spirit portal before Harmonic Convergence, which is only weeks away!
Meanwhile, Varrick has made Bolin into a mover star and saved Asami's company.
Mako is the only one who suspects that Varrick is up to no good, but can he prove it?
Unalaq has forced Korra into opening the Northern portal and trapped Jinora in the Spirit World.
Back in Republic City, everybody loves Varrick's Nuktuk movers.
Everybody, that is, except Mako, whose pursuit of Varrick has landed him in the slammer.
And in the Southern Water Tribe, Unalaq's army is nearing victory in the Civil War, but Tonraq isn't about to give up without a fight.
Bolin is bending two full stacks of earth disks at once, which would normally be illegal, but then again, he's fighting three waterbenders, so all rules are out the window!
The mover's star stopped Varrick's kidnapping attempt on President Raiko, proving his brother's innocence.
Mako and Korra were reunited, but Korra has no memory of their break-up.
Meanwhile, Jinora's spirit is still trapped in the Spirit World, and Tonraq and his southern forces have been defeated.
Now it's up to Team Avatar to stop Unalaq before Harmonic Convergence.
After ten thousand years, Harmonic Convergence is here again, and the dark spirit Vaatu is free.
Tenzin, Bumi, and Kya have entered the portal to rescue Jinora's spirit.
Asami split from the group and took the injured Tonraq to safety.
So it's up to Korra, Mako, and Bolin to stop Unalaq before he fuses with Vaatu and becomes a Dark Avatar.
After fusing with Vaatu, Unalaq became a Dark Avatar and ripped Korra and Raava apart!
By destroying Raava, Unalaq and Vaatu transformed into the most powerful dark spirit that's ever lived.
Tenzin managed to free Jinora from the Fog of Lost Souls, but her spiritual quest isn't over yet.
Can anyone save the world from eternal darkness?
This is Shiro Shinobi, signing off!
The world has entered a new age.
Harmonic Convergence created an energy shift the likes of which has never been felt before.
And after two weeks, Republic City continues to recover from Korra's epic battle with UnaVaatu.
Vines have sprouted up all over, creating pockets of wilds the spirits have come to call home.
What other changes are in store for our city?
After a hundred and seventy years, there are new airbenders in the world and Bumi is one of them!
So too is the mysterious Zaheer, who escaped from his prison thanks to his new ability.
Now banished from Republic City, Korra made it her mission to find the new airbenders.
Will she and Tenzin be able to bring back the Air Nation?
The Air Nation has its first recruit.
Team Avatar's search for new airbenders in the Earth Kingdom led them to Kai, an orphan with a shady past.
Meanwhile, Lord Zuko is hot on the trail of three escaped criminals who pose a great threat to the Avatar.
Unaware of the danger to her, Korra continues her mission to find more airbenders.
Next stop, the walled city of Ba Sing Se.
Airbenders are mysteriously disappearing in Ba Sing Se, including Kai.
The Earth Queen denied any knowledge of the airbenders, but Korra refuse to give up her search.
Meanwhile, Mako and Bolin met their long lost relatives, who told them that Dai Li agents have been rounding up airbenders for the queen's army.
And at a prison in the north, Tonraq and Lord Zuko prepare for Zaheer's imminent attack.
Is there any place safe for the Avatar?
First, President Raiko banished her from Republic City.
Then the Earth Queen declared her an enemy of the Earth Kingdom after Korra rescued a group of airbenders in Ba Sing Se.
And Korra has learned that Zaheer and his fellow criminals are after her.
With Tenzin busy with bringing the new recruits to the Northern Air Temple, Korra's protection rests in Beifong's hands.
After arriving in Zaofu, Korra met Opal, a new airbender whose mother is Lin's estranged half-sister.
Suyin and her daughter welcomed Lin with open arms, but she wanted nothing to do with them.
Meanwhile, Zaheer infiltrated Air Temple Island, looking for the Avatar.
After battling with Kya, he escaped and is now a wanted man in Republic City.
Thanks to the energy shift from Harmonic Convergence, certain people have acquired airbending abilities including Bumi, Kai, and Opal.
Although the new recruits show a lot of promise, they still have a lot to learn.
While Korra remains safe in Zaofu, Tenzin brings the new airbenders to the Northern Air Temple to begin their training.
Korra is now the first metalbending Avatar!
After training with Su Beifong, Korra quickly picked up the new skill, and Bolin is hoping to follow in her footsteps.
Meanwhile, the airbender Zaheer is closing in on Zaofu.
By his side are the lavabender Ghazan, the waterbender Ming-Hua, and the combustionbender P'Li.
But what do these mysterious criminals want with the Avatar?
Zaheer infiltrated Zaofu and attempted to kidnap the Avatar.
After a harrowing battle, she was saved and discovered a shocking truth: Aiwei, Su's trusted adviser, has been working with Zaheer.
This truth seer turned traitor managed to escape but Su tasks Team Avatar of tracking him down.
Now the hunted becomes the hunter as Korra searches for answers.
The Red Lotus is the world's newest threat.
After confronting Zaheer, Korra learned that he is part of a secret society whose mission is to take out all the nations' leaders and destroy world order.
But before Korra could warn anyone, she and Asami were apprehended by the Earth Queen's forces.
And the Red Lotus have Mako and Bolin.
Now both parties are headed toward Ba Sing Se.
After Zaheer and the Red Lotus toppled the Earth Queen, the city descended into chaos.
Meanwhile, Korra and Asami tried to escape their captors, but crashed in the desert.
After getting to safety, they met up with Lord Zuko, Tonraq, and Beifong.
Back in Ba Sing Se, Zaheer freed Mako and Bolin, giving them a vital message to deliver to Korra, but will the brothers find her in time?
The new Air Nation is in jeopardy.
In an effort to force Korra to surrender herself, Zaheer ambushed the Northern Air Temple.
Tenzin, Bumi, and Kya attempted to hold off the Red Lotus, but were injured in battle.
The airbenders were unable to escape and everyone was taken captive except Kai.
Now Korra and Team Avatar race to the temple hoping to mount a rescue.
The Red Lotus has captured the Avatar.
Korra gave herself up in exchange for the airbenders, but Zaheer double crossed her, while Ghazan trapped Team Avatar at the temple.
All seems lost until Bolin saved their lives by lavabending.
But he's not the only one with new skills.
Zaheer unlocked the ancient airbending ability of flight.
Will Team Avatar save the Air Nation and Korra before it's too late?
Welcome to Republic City, the place of hopes, dreams and Spirit Wilds!
This metropolis truly has something for everyone.
Visit Air Temple Island, the hub for all airbenders as they travel the world, helping others.
Or take a stroll through beautiful Avatar Korra Park, named in honor of "You-Know-Who"!
We've missed her these past three years and we can't wait to welcome her home.
And of course, you'll want to see our most unique attractions: the Spirit Wilds.
Here, spirits and people live harmoniously together.
Like this old codger, and his new pals.
Yes siree, this town is truly on the up and up!
Come be a part of the action in Republic City!
Three years ago, Zaheer poisoned Korra, severely injuring her.
While her friends moved on with their lives, Korra remained in the South Pole.
Everyone thought she was still recuperating, but six months ago, Korra left home and hasn't been seen since.
Even Chief Tonraq was shocked to learn that his daughter's whereabouts are unknown.
What has become of the Avatar and when will she return?
So much has changed these past three years!
Mako is a bodyguard for the future Earth King, Prince Wu, while Bolin works for Kuvira, the Earth Kingdom's interim leader, who has brought stability to a nation plagued by chaos.
Meanwhile, after wandering the world trying to heal herself, a spirit led Korra to the swamp, where she met Toph Beifong.
Will this earthbending master be the key to Korra regaining her Avatar mojo?
After Korra failed to return to Republic City, everyone has been worried about her fate.
So Tenzin tasked Jinora, Ikki and Meelo with finding the Avatar.
Unbeknownst to the kids, Korra found refuge in the swamp with Toph, who discovered there was still metal poison in her body, but when Toph tried removing it, Korra resisted.
Will the airbender kids find the Avatar and help her return to action?
After three years, Kuvira has finally united the former Earth Kingdom states under her new Earth Empire banner!
During that same time, Asami rebuilt the company her father created and helped redesign the city's infrastructure.
And, most recently, the airbender kids found the Avatar!
Korra rid herself of the residual poison in her body and is ready to return to action!
Kuvira threatens to take Zaofu by force!
After tensions flared between Su Beifong and her former protégé, Korra brokered a truce, but it was too late.
Su and her sons were already on their way to put an end to Kuvira.
Meanwhile, Bolin and Varrick learned of Kuvira's true tyrannical intent and deserted her army, but they were captured and betrayed by Zhu Li.
Now they're being held against their will!
Kuvira has defeated the Avatar and now controls the entire Earth Empire.
Luckily, the airbender kids and Opal rescued Korra and escaped Zaofu.
For the first time in three years, Korra will finally be back in Republic City!
Meanwhile, Varrick and Bolin escaped from Baatar Jr. and are on the run.
But will they make it back to the city in time to warn everyone about Kuvira's new spirit energy super weapon?
Korra is safely back in Republic City, but Bolin and Varrick are still on the lam!
Weeks ago, Korra removed the remaining poison from her body, but the memory of Zaheer's attack still torments her and, after being defeated by Kuvira, she questions if she will ever fully recover.
Meanwhile, Kuvira has been secretly harvesting spirit vines from the swamp, but how close is she to completing her spirit energy weapon?
After Kuvira harvested spirit vines from the swamp, the vines in Republic City reacted by abducting people.
Korra saved everyone, but all is not well.
Varrick and Bolin returned to warn everyone about Kuvira's spirit vine super weapon.
Now Raiko wants to mount a defense against the Earth Empire!
Meanwhile, Bolin, Opal, and Lin are on a mission to rescue Su Beifong and her family, who are being held captive by Kuvira!
Bolin, Opal, and Lin rescued the Beifongs and Zhu Li from Kuvira.
Now they are racing to Republic City to alert everyone about the Earth Empire's imminent attack.
Meanwhile, Korra and Team Avatar have been preparing for just such an event.
Prince Wu is leading an evacuation effort, while Asami and Varrick are creating flying mecha suits.
But with Kuvira planning to strike in only two weeks, will they be ready in time?
The Earth Empire has invaded the United Republic!
After Kuvira demonstrated the power of her spirit energy weapon, President Raiko surrendered the city, but the Avatar refused to give up without a fight.
Korra held Baatar Jr. hostage, hoping to force Kuvira to back down, but the plan failed and she fired on Team Avatar's hideout.
Can anything or anyone stop Kuvira and her mecha giant?
Republic City is a war zone!
While Prince Wu led the remaining citizens to safety, Team Avatar battled Kuvira's giant mech, but no amount of bending could bring it down!
In a last-ditch effort, Asami and her father outfitted the hummingbird suits with platinum cutters.
Hiroshi helped Team Avatar infiltrate the mecha giant, but he paid the ultimate price!
Is victory within reach for our heroes?
